findings.title: CCR - Contract Centralization Risk
findings.description: The contract's functionality and behavior are heavily dependent on external parameters or configurations, posing centralization risks such as Single Point of Control, Vulnerability to Attacks, Operational Delays, Trust Dependencies, and Decentralization Erosion.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner can set fees to any number through the updateFee function without checks or limitations, potentially leading to unreasonably high or arbitrary amounts and resulting in unreasonable costs for users.

findings.title: MOA - Misleading Owner Assignment
findings.description: The contract sets the `msg.sender` who initiates the first lock as the project owner, which might not always be true and could lead to potential misrepresentation and management issues.

findings.title: MU - Modifiers Usage
findings.description: The contract is using repetitive statements on some methods to validate preconditions instead of using modifiers which can reduce code duplication and improve readability.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity compatible with the specified version can be used to compile the contract, which may lead to unexpected versions being used and producing vulnerabilities.
